text: Paranauchenia is an extinct genus of South American litopterns, related to Macrauchenia, belonging to the same family, Macraucheniidae, and is known only from fossil finds in South America. It possessed three toes and long limbs. The species Paranauchenia denticulata lived in the Miocene epoch in Argentina.Ameghino, F. 1904a. Nuevas especies de mamíferos Cretáceos y Terciarios de la República Argentina. Anales de la Sociedad Científica Argentina 16: 193-208; 17: 162-175, 182-192, 225-240, 241-291. Fossils have been found in the Ituzaingó Formation.Paranauchenia at Fossilworks.org == References == Category:Litopterns Category:Miocene genus extinctions Category:Miocene mammals of South America Category:Huayquerian Category:Neogene Argentina Category:Fossils of Argentina Category:Ituzaingó Formation Category:Fossil taxa described in 1904 Category:Taxa named by Florentino Ameghino
title: Paranauchenia
